suncertify.integration

Class DataRemote

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • suncertify.integration.DataRemote
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, DataMarker, DBAllQueriesRemote

    public class DataRemote
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements DBAllQueriesRemote
    Provides the delegate that let a remote client use the program's functionalities in a distributed fashion.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • read

        public java.lang.String[] read(int recNo)
                        throws RecordNotFoundException,
                               java.rmi.RemoteException
        Reads a record from the file. Returns an array where each element is a record value. If logging is enabled and a RecordNotFoundException is thrown, logs a message to the console.
        Specified by:
        read in interface DBAllQueriesRemote
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number pertaining to a client company
        Returns:
        a data structure containing the state of the client company
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if there is no such record in memory
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an unspecified error occurs on the server side

      • update

        public void update(int recNo,
                   java.lang.String[] data,
                   long lockCookie)
            throws RecordNotFoundException,
                   java.lang.SecurityException,
                   java.rmi.RemoteException
        Modifies the fields of a record. The new value for field n appears in data[n]. If logging is enabled and a RecordNotFoundException or SecurityException are thrown, logs a message to the console.
        Specified by:
        update in interface DBAllQueriesRemote
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number pertaining to a client company
        data - the new state of the client company
        lockCookie - the id security token that locked the record number
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if there is no such record in memory
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an unspecified error occurs on the server side

                   long lockCookie)
            throws RecordNotFoundException,
                   java.lang.SecurityException,
                   java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deletes a record, making the record number and associated disk storage available for reuse. If logging is enabled and a RecordNotFoundException or SecurityException are thrown, logs a message to the console.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface DBAllQueriesRemote
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number pertaining to a client company
        lockCookie - the id security token that locked the record number
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if there is no such record in memory
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an unspecified error occurs on the server side

      • find

        public int[] find(java.lang.String[] criteria)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".)
        Specified by:
        find in interface DBAllQueriesRemote
        Parameters:
        criteria - the data structure that contains the search criteria
        Returns:
        a data structure that contains the records numbers that match the criteria
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an unspecified error occurs on the server side

      • findByNameAndLocation

        public int[] findByNameAndLocation(java.lang.String[] criteria)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Searches for matching record numbers on the basis of name and location. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that has an exact match on criteria[n]. (For example, "Philarmonic Remodeling" matches "Philharmonic Remodeling").
        Specified by:
        findByNameAndLocation in interface DBAllQueriesRemote
        Parameters:
        criteria - the data structure that contains the search criteria
        Returns:
        a data structure that contains the record numbers that match the criteria
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an unspecified error occurs on the server side

      • create

        public int create(java.lang.String[] data)
           throws DuplicateKeyException,
                  java.rmi.RemoteException
        Creates a new record in the database (possibly reusing a deleted entry). Inserts the given data, and returns the record number of the new record. If logging is enabled and a DuplicateKeyException is thrown, logs a message to the console.
        Specified by:
        create in interface DBAllQueriesRemote
        Parameters:
        data - the data structure that contains the new record state
        Returns:
        the record number of the new record
        Throws:
        DuplicateKeyException - if the client company name and geographical location already exists in memory
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an unspecified error occurs on the server side

      • lock

        public long lock(int recNo)
          throws RecordNotFoundException,
                 java.rmi.RemoteException
        Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. Returned value is a cookie that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted. If the specified record is already locked by a different client, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked. If logging is enabled and a DuplicateKeyException is thrown, logs a message to the console.
        Specified by:
        lock in interface DBAllQueriesRemote
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number to lock
        Returns:
        an identification security token
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if there is no such record in memory
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an unspecified error occurs on the server side

      • unlock

        public void unlock(int recNo,
                   long cookie)
            throws RecordNotFoundException,
                   java.lang.SecurityException,
                   java.rmi.RemoteException
        Releases the lock on a record. Cookie must be the cookie returned when the record was locked; otherwise throws SecurityException. If logging is enabled and a RecordNotFoundException or SecurityException are thrown, logs a message to the console.
        Specified by:
        unlock in interface DBAllQueriesRemote
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number to unlock
        cookie - the identification security token
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if there is no such record in memory
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an unspecified error occurs on the server side

      • getList

        public java.util.List<CustomerRecord> getList()
                                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Accesses all object-oriented mapped customer records listed in memory, and returns them in a data structure.
        Specified by:
        getList in interface DBAllQueriesRemote
        Returns:
        a data structure containing all customer records listed in memory
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an unspecified error occurs on the server side
